org.epochx.op.selection
Class LinearRankSelector

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.op.selection.LinearRankSelector
All Implemented Interfaces:
PoolSelector, ProgramSelector
public class LinearRankSelector
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProgramSelector, PoolSelector

Linear rank selection chooses programs by fitness rank. All the programs in the population are ranked according to their fitness from lowest to highest. Each program is then assigned a probability according to their rank in a linear fashion with a gradient as given at construction. Programs are selected according to this probability.

Valid gradients are values between 0.0 and 1.0. A gradient of 1.0 is generally not very useful since it will result in all ranks being assigned the same probability, and as such will provide no selection pressure at all. A gradient of 0.0 on the other hand will provide the largest selection pressure, with the least fit individual having a probability of selection of 0.0 meaning it will never be selected.

See Also:
FitnessProportionateSelector, RandomSelector, TournamentSelector

model - the Model which defines the run parameters such as the random number generator to use.
gradient - a value between 0.0 and 1.0 which indicates the gradient at which fitnesses are assigned to ranks.
Method Detail

setGradient

public void setGradient(double gradient)
Sets the gradient of the linear probabilities. Valid gradients are between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive, where a smaller value provides a steeper gradient and a larger probability difference between the worst and best individuals. A gradient of 1.0 will be a level gradient and as such will provide no selection pressure at all.

Parameters:
gradient - the gradient to use when assigning probabilities, between 0.0 and 1.0.

getGradient

public double getGradient()
Gets the gradient of the linear probabilities.

Returns:
a double between 0.0 and 1.0 representing the gradient of the probabilities where 0.0 is a steep gradient and 1.0 is no gradient.

getWorstProbability

public double getWorstProbability(int popSize)
Gets the probability of the worst program being selected with the current gradient.

Returns:
the probability of the worst program being selected.

getBestProbability

public double getBestProbability(int popSize)
Gets the probability of the best program being selected with the current gradient.

Returns:
the probability of the best program being selected.

setSelectionPool

public void setSelectionPool(java.util.List<CandidateProgram> pool)
Sets the population from which programs will be selected. The probabilities are calculated once at this point based upon the linear fitness rank.

Specified by:
setSelectionPool in interface ProgramSelector
Parameters:
pool - the population of candidate programs from which programs should be selected.

getProgram

public CandidateProgram getProgram()
Selects a candidate program at random from the population according to the probabilities which were assigned based on fitness rank.

Specified by:
getProgram in interface ProgramSelector
Returns:
a program selected from the current population based on fitness rank.

getPool

public java.util.List<CandidateProgram> getPool(java.util.List<CandidateProgram> pop,
                                                int poolSize)
Constructs a pool of programs from the population, choosing each one with the program selection element of LinearRankSelector. The size of the pool created will be equal to the poolSize argument. The generated pool may contain duplicate programs, and as such the pool size may be greater than the population size.

Specified by:
getPool in interface PoolSelector
Parameters:
pop - the population of CandidatePrograms from which the programs in the pool should be chosen.
poolSize - the number of programs that should be selected from the population to form the pool. The poolSize must be 1 or greater.
Returns:
the pool of candidate programs selected according to fitness rank.
